files.description: Canonical QA runner that prefers Docker container execution but deterministically falls back to a failsafe no-container mode that always writes /outputs/qa/QA_REPORT.json and logs with stable exit codes.
Pure-Python failsafe QA implementation reusing existing checks (file presence, JSON schema validation, optional linkcheck) and producing a deterministic QA_REPORT payload for the main runner.
Docker integration helpers for the QA runner including container availability detection, robust invocation, log capture, and explicit error classification to trigger failsafe mode.
Shared report/logging utilities that guarantee report directory creation, atomic JSON writing of QA_REPORT.json, and consistent exit-code mapping across container and failsafe modes.
Reusable check logic (expected output file presence, JSON parseability, schema validation via pure-Python, and linkcheck adapter) consumed by both container and no-container execution paths.
JSON Schema defining the required structure of /outputs/qa/QA_REPORT.json to ensure machine-validated, stable reporting across all execution environments.
Minimal pure-Python JSON Schema validator shim (supporting the subset used by this project) to avoid external dependencies in failsafe no-container mode.

missionDescription: Implement a 'failsafe no-container mode' in the canonical QA runner so it can still generate /outputs/qa/QA_REPORT.json and logs when the execution container is unavailable. Reuse existing check logic where possible (file presence, schema validation via pure-python, linkcheck optional). Ensure deterministic exit codes and always-write reports.
missionSuccessCriteria: Complete strategic task identified by Meta-Coordinator or escalated by Strategic Tracker

Repeated 'container lost' prevents producing any execution-backed artifacts. A failsafe mode ensures we can still generate trustworthy QA reports and unblock progress while deeper container stability is investigated.
